meta.content: Official Municipal Web Site of the Town of Westfield, Union County, New Jersey

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Westfield, New Jersey, Union County, NJ, Town

Mental Health Professionals Local, licensed, mental health professionals who have offered their services pro bono: 
Steve Becker, LCSW, 908-456-2679, https://www.powercommunicating.com Irv Finkelstein, LCSW, 908-389-0682
  Organizations and Web Sites
Mental Health Association of New Jersey New Jersey Department of Children and Hotlines and Helplines (PDF) Managing Stress and Coping from the CDC
  Union County Virtual Resources
Union County offers several COVID-19 resources including virtual community support groups and webinars. Learn more at http://www.unionresourcenet.org/news-events/events/
  Caring Contact Crisis Line and National Suicide Prevention Lifeline in Westfield
For general, non-emergency listening: 908-232-2880 7:00AM - 11:00PM, based on volunteer availability Text "741741" for Crisis Text Line For mental health emergencies that do not require in-person intervention: 800-273-8255 (24/7 coverage) For additional resources, please visit westfieldnj.gov/mentalhealth
 
Mental Health Disaster Response
Should you or someone you know need information about Union County Mental Health Services, please note the following:
For 24 Hour Emergency Psychiatric Services, please contact:
Mobile Community Outreach (Adults): (908) 994-7131 Union County Mobile Response & Stabilization (Children): (877) 652-7624 RWJ University Hospital: (732) 381-4200 Overlook Hospital: 908-522-2000
Should you need information about mental health or addiction services in Union County, please dial: 908-527-4846 or 908-527-4844.
  Mental Health Council Education Corner To support the growing needs of our residents, the Mental Health Council is researching and providing resources on mental health and education related topics. We are in the process of creating resource of lists, articles, guides, online videos, and more to help parents, teachers, professionals, and children and teens themselves to assist in social, academic, behavioral, and emotional development. View the resources  
Return to the Coronavirus Information Center Return to the Mental Health Council

div.h2: Caring Contact Crisis Line and National Suicide Prevention Lifeline in Westfield

ul.li: For general, non-emergency listening: 908-232-2880 7:00AM - 11:00PM, based on volunteer availability
For mental health emergencies that do not require in-person intervention: 800-273-8255 (24/7 coverage)
For additional resources, please visit westfieldnj.gov/mentalhealth

div.p: Should you or someone you know need information about Union County Mental Health Services, please note the following:

ul.li: For 24 Hour Emergency Psychiatric Services, please contact:
Should you need information about mental health or addiction services in Union County, please dial: 908-527-4846 or 908-527-4844.
